purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application resource for the representation of .
The aspects of risk management, whether positive or negative, that result in an opportunity for benefit or threat to it succeeding are included.
The risk_schema identifies risks as they are perceived each with their probability and consequences pertaining to events or situations.

inscope.li: identification and representation of a risk;
representation of the relationships between risks;
identification and representation of the perception of a risk;
representation of the relationships between perceptions of risks;
representation of the context of the risk and risk_perception;
assignment and representation of the probability or likelihood of the risk;
representation of the consequence of the risk;
representation of a risk criteria;
representation of a risk_treatment and its primary and secondary mitigation objectives;
representation of a risk_reduction and the mitigation objectives it resolves;
representation of a risk_evaluation;
representation of the processes of risk_identification, source_identification, risk_analysis, risk_assessment, risk_control, risk_estimation, and risk_communication;
representation of the impact of the risk, if any, and its causing consequence;
assignment of any items impacted by the risk;
representation of the status a risk possesses;
assignment of an owner to risk;
assignment of the source of risk;
representation of a risk_resource and its usage;
assignment of classification information to risk data;
representation of a risk stakeholder;
communication of risk data between stakeholders.

outscope.li: process to develop of a risk management system.

definition.def: the potential for realization of unwanted negative consequences of an event.

introduction.p: The risk_schema identifies a by specifying the potential for realization of unwanted negative consequences of an event. A is accounted by the existence of general uncertainty and feared events.
introduction.note: A associated with general uncertainty is refered to as unknown unknowns
A of feared events is refered to as known unknowns
introduction.p: The identification of a can describe the concern at hand which may be related to more than one event with more than one possible outcome or consequence.
introduction.example: Project Bravo has entered Phase II with a major subsystem functioning in Mode Number 5.
introduction.p: As is always present, more than one perception of a is possible. The representaion of a describes a in a particular context along with the probability of an event and its corresponding consequence or consequences.

A is not limited to events but may apply to products, people, organizations, or to other items of interest, as defined by Application Protocols or Modules that use this resource part that have the potential for generating risks of general uncertainty.

fund_cons.p: A can be determinately identifed by a set of recognisable assessments or perceptions that can be used to distinguish all relevant possible outcomes.
In this part of ISO 10303 such a perception is recorded as an instance of the entity.
fund_cons.note: A is susceptible to reassessment over time. The assigns a stage for such assessments.
fund_cons.p: Providing meaningful value for an assessment requires that a comparison be made against predetermined standards or criteria to which a value-based judgement or decision point can be made. The evaluation of such an assessment is represented by .

select those risk data elements that have been chosen for such a change.

Based on the or method of , the change may involve a risk data element to be lessened in its likelihood of occurring, reduction of its consequence, or other distinctive element that would otherwise result in a reassessment of the .
